next_reinforce_apply.title: get_corporations_corporation_id_structures_next_reinforce_apply

profile_id.description: The id of the ACL profile for this citadel

reinforce_hour.title: get_corporations_corporation_id_structures_reinforce_hour
reinforce_hour.description: The hour of day that determines the four hour window when the structure will randomly exit its reinforcement periods and become vulnerable to attack against its armor and/or hull. The structure will become vulnerable at a random time that is +/- 2 hours centered on the value of this property

system_id.description: The solar system the structure is in

next_reinforce_hour.title: get_corporations_corporation_id_structures_next_reinforce_hour

structure_id.description: The Item ID of the structure

state_timer_start.description: Date at which the structure entered it's current state
state_timer_start.title: get_corporations_corporation_id_structures_state_timer_start

reinforce_weekday.title: get_corporations_corporation_id_structures_reinforce_weekday
reinforce_weekday.description: The day of the week when the structure exits its final reinforcement period and becomes vulnerable to attack against its hull. Monday is 0 and Sunday is 6

type_id.description: The type id of the structure

fuel_expires.description: Date on which the structure will run out of fuel

corporation_id.description: ID of the corporation that owns the structure

state_timer_end.description: Date at which the structure will move to it's next state

get.description:
Retrieve the given character's wallet journal going 30 days back

---

This route is cached for up to 3600 seconds

context_id.description: An ID that gives extra context to the particular transaction. Because of legacy reasons the context is completely different per ref_type and means different things. It is also possible to not have a context_id
context_id.title: get_characters_character_id_wallet_journal_context_id

description.description: The reason for the transaction, mirrors what is seen in the client
description.title: get_characters_character_id_wallet_journal_description

tax_receiver_id.description: The corporation ID receiving any tax paid. Only applies to tax related transactions
tax_receiver_id.title: get_characters_character_id_wallet_journal_tax_receiver_id

reason.description: The user stated reason for the transaction. Only applies to some ref_types
reason.title: get_characters_character_id_wallet_journal_reason

context_id_type.description: The type of the given context_id if present
context_id_type.title: get_characters_character_id_wallet_journal_context_id_type

tax.description: Tax amount received. Only applies to tax related transactions
tax.title: get_characters_character_id_wallet_journal_tax

second_party_id.description: The id of the second party involved in the transaction. This attribute has no consistency and is different or non existant for particular ref_types. The description attribute will help make sense of what this attribute means. For more info about the given ID it can be dropped into the /universe/names/ ESI route to determine its type and name
second_party_id.title: get_characters_character_id_wallet_journal_second_party_id

amount.description: The amount of ISK given or taken from the wallet as a result of the given transaction. Positive when ISK is deposited into the wallet and negative when ISK is withdrawn
amount.title: get_characters_character_id_wallet_journal_amount

first_party_id.description: The id of the first party involved in the transaction. This attribute has no consistency and is different or non existant for particular ref_types. The description attribute will help make sense of what this attribute means. For more info about the given ID it can be dropped into the /universe/names/ ESI route to determine its type and name
first_party_id.title: get_characters_character_id_wallet_journal_first_party_id

ref_type.description: "The transaction type for the given. transaction. Different transaction types will populate different attributes. Note: If you have an existing XML API application that is using ref_types, you will need to know which string ESI ref_type maps to which integer. You can look at the following file to see string->int mappings: https://github.com/ccpgames/eve-glue/blob/master/eve_glue/wallet_journal_ref.py"
ref_type.title: get_characters_character_id_wallet_journal_ref_type

context_id_type.title: get_corporations_corporation_id_wallets_division_journal_context_id_type

tax.description: Tax amount received. Only applies to tax related transactions
tax.title: get_corporations_corporation_id_wallets_division_journal_tax

second_party_id.description: The id of the second party involved in the transaction. This attribute has no consistency and is different or non existant for particular ref_types. The description attribute will help make sense of what this attribute means. For more info about the given ID it can be dropped into the /universe/names/ ESI route to determine its type and name
second_party_id.title: get_corporations_corporation_id_wallets_division_journal_second_party_id

amount.description: The amount of ISK given or taken from the wallet as a result of the given transaction. Positive when ISK is deposited into the wallet and negative when ISK is withdrawn
amount.title: get_corporations_corporation_id_wallets_division_journal_amount

first_party_id.description: The id of the first party involved in the transaction. This attribute has no consistency and is different or non existant for particular ref_types. The description attribute will help make sense of what this attribute means. For more info about the given ID it can be dropped into the /universe/names/ ESI route to determine its type and name
first_party_id.title: get_corporations_corporation_id_wallets_division_journal_first_party_id

ref_type.description: "The transaction type for the given. transaction. Different transaction types will populate different attributes. Note: If you have an existing XML API application that is using ref_types, you will need to know which string ESI ref_type maps to which integer. You can look at the following file to see string->int mappings: https://github.com/ccpgames/eve-glue/blob/master/eve_glue/wallet_journal_ref.py"
ref_type.title: get_corporations_corporation_id_wallets_division_journal_ref_type

onlined_since.title: get_corporations_corporation_id_starbases_onlined_since

unanchor_at.description: When the POS started unanchoring, for starbases (POSes) in unanchoring state
unanchor_at.title: get_corporations_corporation_id_starbases_unanchor_at

system_id.description: The solar system this starbase (POS) is in, unanchored POSes have this information

reinforced_until.description: When the POS will be out of reinforcement, for starbases (POSes) in reinforced state
reinforced_until.title: get_corporations_corporation_id_starbases_reinforced_until

moon_id.description: The moon this starbase (POS) is anchored on, unanchored POSes do not have this information
